result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon Duane Mitchell

Request by Atty Key's Office to reschedule the 6/30/22 jury status hearing due to a scheduling conflict.  No objection by DA Steiner.  JA approved and rescheduled to 7/7/22 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.

03:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon Duane Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Jon Duane Mitchell.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

3:41 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon Duane Mitchell in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Jon Duane Mitchell.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire  form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. Atty Key is heard and is ready to proceed to arraignment. 
Information brought over. Atty Key is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jon Duane Mitchell appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

DA Request a cash bond of  $500.00; Defendant shall not possess alcohol outside of defendant's business.  Def shall not consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.

Court orders a cash bond of $500.00; Defendant shall not possess alcohol outside of defendants business, defendant shall not consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
